markdownRemark.html:
“Mendicants, in the present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent. What’s impermanent is suffering. …”

SN.35.222. Ajjhattāyatanaaniccasutta (“The Interior as Impermanent”)

What’s impermanent is suffering. …”

frontmatter.title: Saṁyutta Nikāya ("The Linked Discourses")
frontmatter.excerpt: SN.35.206. Ajjhattapaccuppannayadaniccasutta ("The Interior and What’s Impermanent in the Present")

prev.excerpt:
“Mendicants, in the future the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind will be impermanent. 
What’s impermanent is suffering …”  SN.35.20…

frontmatter.title: Saṁyutta Nikāya ("The Linked Discourses")
frontmatter.excerpt: SN.35.205. Ajjhattānāgatayadaniccasutta ("The Interior and What’s Impermanent in the Future")

next.excerpt:
“Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering. 
What’s suffering is not-self …”  SN…

frontmatter.title: Saṁyutta Nikāya ("The Linked Discourses")
frontmatter.excerpt: SN.35.207–209. Ajjhattātītādiyaṁdukkhasutta ("The Interior and What’s Suffering in the Three Times")
